functions.name: log_from_linear_memory
functions.docs: Emit a diagnostic event containing a message and sequence of `RawVal`s.

functions.name: get_invoking_contract
functions.docs: Get the contractID `Bytes` of the contract which invoked the running contract. Traps if the running contract was not invoked by a contract.

functions.name: obj_cmp
functions.docs: Compare two objects, or at least one object to a non-object, structurally. Returns -1 if a<b, 1 if a>b, or 0 if a==b.

functions.name: contract_event
functions.docs: Records a contract event. `topics` is expected to be a `SCVec` with length <= 4 that cannot contain `Vec`, `Map`, or `Bytes` with length > 32.

functions.name: get_current_contract_id
functions.docs: Gets the 32-byte identifer of the current contract. Traps if the running contract was not invoked by a contract.

functions.name: get_ledger_version
functions.docs: Return the protocol version of the current ledger as a u32.

functions.name: get_ledger_sequence
functions.docs: Return the sequence number of the current ledger as a u32.

functions.name: get_ledger_timestamp
functions.docs: Return the timestamp number of the current ledger as a u64.

functions.name: get_current_call_stack
functions.docs: Returns the full call stack from the first contract call to the current one as a vector of vectors, where the inside vector contains the contract id as Hash, and a function as a Symbol.

functions.name: fail_with_error
functions.docs: Causes the currently executing contract to fail immediately with a provided error code, which must be of error-type `ScErrorType::Contract`. Does not actually return.

functions.name: get_ledger_network_id
functions.docs: Return the network id (sha256 hash of network passphrase) of the current ledger as `Bytes`. The value is always 32 bytes in length.

functions.name: get_current_contract_address
functions.docs: Get the Address object for the current contract.

functions.name: obj_from_u64
functions.docs: Convert a u64 to an object containing a u64.

functions.name: obj_to_u64
functions.docs: Convert an object containing a i64 to a u64.

functions.name: obj_from_i64
functions.docs: Convert an i64 to an object containing an i64.

functions.name: obj_to_i64
functions.docs: Convert an object containing an i64 to an i64.

functions.name: obj_from_u128_pieces
functions.docs: Convert the high and low 64-bit words of a u128 to an object containing a u128.

functions.name: obj_to_u128_lo64
functions.docs: Extract the low 64 bits from an object containing a u128.

functions.name: obj_to_u128_hi64
functions.docs: Extract the high 64 bits from an object containing a u128.

functions.name: obj_from_i128_pieces
functions.docs: Convert the high and low 64-bit words of an i128 to an object containing an i128.

functions.name: obj_to_i128_lo64
functions.docs: Extract the low 64 bits from an object containing an i128.

functions.name: obj_to_i128_hi64
functions.docs: Extract the high 64 bits from an object containing an i128.

functions.name: obj_from_u256_pieces
functions.docs: Convert the four 64-bit words of an u256 (big-endian) to an object containing an u256.

functions.name: obj_to_u256_hi_hi
functions.docs: Extract the highest 64-bits (bits 192-255) from an object containing an u256.

functions.name: obj_to_u256_hi_lo
functions.docs: Extract bits 128-191 from an object containing an u256.

functions.name: obj_to_u256_lo_hi
functions.docs: Extract bits 64-127 from an object containing an u256.

functions.name: obj_to_u256_lo_lo
functions.docs: Extract the lowest 64-bits (bits 0-63) from an object containing an u256.

functions.name: obj_from_i256_pieces
functions.docs: Convert the four 64-bit words of an i256 (big-endian) to an object containing an i256.

functions.name: obj_to_i256_hi_hi
functions.docs: Extract the highest 64-bits (bits 192-255) from an object containing an i256.

functions.name: obj_to_i256_hi_lo
functions.docs: Extract bits 128-191 from an object containing an i256.

functions.name: obj_to_i256_lo_hi
functions.docs: Extract bits 64-127 from an object containing an i256.

functions.name: obj_to_i256_lo_lo
functions.docs: Extract the lowest 64-bits (bits 0-63) from an object containing an i256.

functions.name: map_new
functions.docs: Create an empty new map.

functions.name: map_put
functions.docs: Insert a key/value mapping into an existing map, and return the map object handle. If the map already has a mapping for the given key, the previous value is overwritten.

functions.name: map_get
functions.docs: Get the value for a key from a map. Traps if key is not found.

functions.name: map_del
functions.docs: Remove a key/value mapping from a map if it exists, traps if doesn't.

functions.name: map_len
functions.docs: Get the size of a map.

functions.name: map_has
functions.docs: Test for the presence of a key in a map. Returns Bool.

functions.name: map_prev_key
functions.docs: Given a key, find the first key less than itself in the map's sorted order. If such a key does not exist, return an ScError.

functions.name: map_next_key
functions.docs: Given a key, find the first key greater than itself in the map's sorted order. If such a key does not exist, return an ScError.

functions.name: map_min_key
functions.docs: Find the minimum key from a map. If the map is empty, return an ScError.

functions.name: map_max_key
functions.docs: Find the maximum key from a map. If the map is empty, return an ScError.

functions.name: map_keys
functions.docs: Return a new vector containing all the keys in a map. The new vector is ordered in the original map's key-sorted order.

functions.name: map_values
functions.docs: Return a new vector containing all the values in a map. The new vector is ordered in the original map's key-sorted order.

functions.name: map_new_from_linear_memory
functions.docs: Return a new map initialized from a set of input slices given by linear-memory addresses and lengths.

functions.name: map_unpack_to_linear_memory
functions.docs: Copy the RawVal values of a map, as described by set of input keys, into an array at a given linear-memory address.

functions.name: vec_new
functions.docs: Creates a new vector with an optional capacity hint `c`. If `c` is `Void`, no hint is assumed and the new vector is empty. Otherwise, `c` is parsed as an `u32` that represents the initial capacity of the new vector.

functions.name: vec_put
functions.docs: Update the value at index `i` in the vector. Return the new vector. Trap if the index is out of bounds.

functions.name: vec_get
functions.docs: Returns the element at index `i` of the vector. Traps if the index is out of bound.

functions.name: vec_del
functions.docs: Delete an element in a vector at index `i`, shifting all elements after it to the left. Return the new vector. Traps if the index is out of bound.

functions.name: vec_len
functions.docs: Returns length of the vector.

functions.name: vec_push_front
functions.docs: Push a value to the front of a vector.

functions.name: vec_pop_front
functions.docs: Removes the first element from the vector and returns the new vector. Traps if original vector is empty.

functions.name: vec_push_back
functions.docs: Appends an element to the back of the vector.

functions.name: vec_pop_back
functions.docs: Removes the last element from the vector and returns the new vector. Traps if original vector is empty.

functions.name: vec_front
functions.docs: Return the first element in the vector. Traps if the vector is empty

functions.name: vec_back
functions.docs: Return the last element in the vector. Traps if the vector is empty

functions.name: vec_insert
functions.docs: Inserts an element at index `i` within the vector, shifting all elements after it to the right. Traps if the index is out of bound

functions.name: vec_append
functions.docs: Clone the vector `v1`, then moves all the elements of vector `v2` into it. Return the new vector. Traps if number of elements in the vector overflows a u32.

functions.name: vec_slice
functions.docs: Copy the elements from `start` index until `end` index, exclusive, in the vector and create a new vector from it. Return the new vector. Traps if the index is out of bound.

functions.name: vec_first_index_of
functions.docs: Get the index of the first occurrence of a given element in the vector. Returns the u32 index of the value if it's there. Otherwise, it returns `Void`.

functions.name: vec_last_index_of
functions.docs: Get the index of the last occurrence of a given element in the vector. Returns the u32 index of the value if it's there. Otherwise, it returns `Void`.

functions.name: vec_binary_search
functions.docs: Binary search a sorted vector for a given element. If it exists, the high-32 bits of the return value is 0x0001 and the low-32 bits contain the u32 index of the element. If it does not exist, the high-32 bits of the return value is 0x0000 and the low-32 bits contain the u32 index at which the element would need to be inserted into the vector to maintain sorted order.

functions.name: vec_new_from_linear_memory
functions.docs: Return a new vec initialized from an input slice of RawVals given by a linear-memory address and length.

functions.name: vec_unpack_to_linear_memory
functions.docs: Copy the RawVals of a vec into an array at a given linear-memory address.

functions.name: put_contract_data
functions.docs: If `f` is `Void`, then there will be no changes to flags for an existing entry, and none will be set if this is a new entry. Otherwise, `f` is parsed as a `u32`. If the value is 0, then all flags are cleared. If it's not 0, then we OR the value with the existing flags (if an entry exists). If this is a new entry, then flags will be set this the value passed in.

functions.name: create_contract
functions.docs: Creates the contract instance on behalf of `deployer`. `deployer` must authorize this call via Soroban auth framework, i.e. this calls `deployer.require_auth` with respective arguments. `wasm_hash` must be a hash of the contract code that has already been uploaded on this network. `salt` is used to create a unique contract id. Returns the address of the created contract.

functions.name: create_asset_contract
functions.docs: Creates the instance of Stellar Asset contract corresponding to the provided asset. `serialized_asset` is `stellar::Asset` XDR serialized to bytes format. Returns the address of the created contract.

functions.name: upload_wasm
functions.docs: Uploads provided `wasm` bytecode to the network and returns its identifier (SHA-256 hash). No-op in case if the same Wasm object already exists.

functions.name: update_current_contract_wasm
functions.docs: Replaces the executable of the current contract with the provided Wasm code identified by a hash. Wasm entry corresponding to the hash has to already be present in the ledger. The update happens only after the current contract invocation has successfully finished, so this can be safely called in the middle of a function.

functions.name: call
functions.docs: Calls a function in another contract with arguments contained in vector `args`. If the call is successful, returns the result of the called function. Traps otherwise.

functions.name: try_call
functions.docs: Calls a function in another contract with arguments contained in vector `args`, returning either the result of the called function or an ScError if the called function failed.

functions.name: serialize_to_bytes
functions.docs: Serializes an (SC)Val into XDR opaque `Bytes` object.

functions.name: deserialize_from_bytes
functions.docs: Deserialize a `Bytes` object to get back the (SC)Val.

functions.name: bytes_copy_to_linear_memory
functions.docs: Copies a slice of bytes from a `Bytes` object specified at offset `b_pos` with length `len` into the linear memory at position `lm_pos`. Traps if either the `Bytes` object or the linear memory doesn't have enough bytes.

functions.name: bytes_copy_from_linear_memory
functions.docs: Copies a segment of the linear memory specified at position `lm_pos` with length `len`, into a `Bytes` object at offset `b_pos`. The `Bytes` object may grow in size to accommodate the new bytes. Traps if the linear memory doesn't have enough bytes.

functions.name: bytes_new_from_linear_memory
functions.docs: Constructs a new `Bytes` object initialized with bytes copied from a linear memory slice specified at position `lm_pos` with length `len`.

functions.name: bytes_new
functions.docs: Create an empty new `Bytes` object.

functions.name: bytes_put
functions.docs: Update the value at index `i` in the `Bytes` object. Return the new `Bytes`. Trap if the index is out of bounds.

functions.name: bytes_get
functions.docs: Returns the element at index `i` of the `Bytes` object. Traps if the index is out of bound.

functions.name: bytes_del
functions.docs: Delete an element in a `Bytes` object at index `i`, shifting all elements after it to the left. Return the new `Bytes`. Traps if the index is out of bound.

functions.name: bytes_len
functions.docs: Returns length of the `Bytes` object.

functions.name: bytes_push
functions.docs: Appends an element to the back of the `Bytes` object.

functions.name: bytes_pop
functions.docs: Removes the last element from the `Bytes` object and returns the new `Bytes`. Traps if original `Bytes` is empty.

functions.name: bytes_front
functions.docs: Return the first element in the `Bytes` object. Traps if the `Bytes` is empty

functions.name: bytes_back
functions.docs: Return the last element in the `Bytes` object. Traps if the `Bytes` is empty

functions.name: bytes_insert
functions.docs: Inserts an element at index `i` within the `Bytes` object, shifting all elements after it to the right. Traps if the index is out of bound

functions.name: bytes_append
functions.docs: Clone the `Bytes` object `b1`, then moves all the elements of `Bytes` object `b2` into it. Return the new `Bytes`. Traps if its length overflows a u32.

functions.name: bytes_slice
functions.docs: Copies the elements from `start` index until `end` index, exclusive, in the `Bytes` object and creates a new `Bytes` from it. Returns the new `Bytes`. Traps if the index is out of bound.

functions.name: string_copy_to_linear_memory
functions.docs: Copies a slice of bytes from a `String` object specified at offset `s_pos` with length `len` into the linear memory at position `lm_pos`. Traps if either the `String` object or the linear memory doesn't have enough bytes.

functions.name: symbol_copy_to_linear_memory
functions.docs: Copies a slice of bytes from a `Symbol` object specified at offset `s_pos` with length `len` into the linear memory at position `lm_pos`. Traps if either the `String` object or the linear memory doesn't have enough bytes.

functions.name: string_new_from_linear_memory
functions.docs: Constructs a new `String` object initialized with bytes copied from a linear memory slice specified at position `lm_pos` with length `len`.

functions.name: symbol_new_from_linear_memory
functions.docs: Constructs a new `Symbol` object initialized with bytes copied from a linear memory slice specified at position `lm_pos` with length `len`.

functions.name: string_len
functions.docs: Returns length of the `String` object.

functions.name: symbol_len
functions.docs: Returns length of the `Symbol` object.

functions.name: symbol_index_in_linear_memory
functions.docs: Return the index of a Symbol in an array of linear-memory byte-slices, or trap if not found.

functions.name: require_auth_for_args
functions.docs: Checks if the address has authorized the invocation of the current contract function with the provided arguments. Traps if the invocation hasn't been authorized.

functions.name: require_auth
functions.docs: Checks if the address has authorized the invocation of the current contract function with all the arguments of the invocation. Traps if the invocation hasn't been authorized.

functions.name: account_public_key_to_address
functions.docs: Converts a provided 32-byte Stellar account public key to the corresponding address. This is only useful in the context of cross-chain interoperability. Prefer directly using the Address objects whenever possible.

functions.name: contract_id_to_address
functions.docs: Converts a provided 32-byte contract identifier to a corresponding Address object.

functions.name: address_to_account_public_key
functions.docs: Returns the 32-byte public key of the Stellar account corresponding to the provided Address object. If the Address doesn't belong to an account, returns RawVal corresponding to the unit type (`()`).

functions.name: address_to_contract_id
functions.docs: Returns the 32-byte contract identifier corresponding to the provided Address object. If the Address doesn't belong to an account, returns RawVal corresponding to the unit type (`()`).

functions.name: dummy0
functions.docs: A dummy function taking 0 arguments and performs no-op. This function is for test purpose only, for measuring the roundtrip cost of invoking a host function, i.e. host->Vm->host.

functions.name: prng_reseed
functions.docs: Reseed the frame-local PRNG with a given BytesObject, which should be 32 bytes long.

functions.name: prng_bytes_new
functions.docs: Construct a new BytesObject of the given length filled with bytes drawn from the frame-local PRNG.

functions.name: prng_u64_in_inclusive_range
functions.docs: Return a u64 uniformly sampled from the inclusive range [lo,hi] by the frame-local PRNG.

functions.name: prng_vec_shuffle
functions.docs: Return a (Fisher-Yates) shuffled clone of a given vector, using the frame-local PRNG.
